dct_title_s: ATLAS NOVUS SIVE TABULAE GEOGRPHICAE TOTIUS ORBIS FACIEM, PARTES, IMPERIA, REGNA ET PROVINCIAS EXHIBENTES, EXACTISSIMA CURA IUXTA RECENTISSIMAS OBSERVATION
dct_description_sm: Map in color. Title page is nearly identical with one produced by Lotter (Seutterâ€™s son-in-law) (State 1) except locations of small maps of America and Africa have been exchanged, placing America near the figure of an elephant. Smaller maps location: Europa (upper left), Africa (upper right), Asia (lower left), and America (lower right).

Iacob Christoph Weijerman inv et delin: (lower left). Martin Gottfrid Grophus sculps. (lower right). Title page displays central globe showing Eastern Hemisphere surrounded by many figures, animals and influences of science, discovery and exploration. These are organized around 4 main geographical areas, depicted by regional representatives holding smaller maps: Europa, America, Asia, and Africa. California shown as island on small map of America. Title cartouche, bottom center.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
